summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This is the beginning of the gospel of Jesus the Messiah, the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the prophet Isaiah,
“See! I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a voice calling out in the wilderness:
    ‘Prepare the way for the Lord!
        Make his paths straight!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was baptizing in the wilderness, proclaiming a baptism about repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People from the whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem were flocking to him, being baptized by him while they confessed their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John was dressed in camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist. He ate grasshoppers and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kept proclaiming, “The one who is coming after me is stronger than I am, and I am not worthy to bend down and untie his sandal straps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptized you with water, but it is he who will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as he was coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens split open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love. I am pleased with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the Spirit drove him into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the wilderness for 40 days being tempted by Satan. He was among wild animals, and angels were ministering to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after John had been arrested, Jesus went to Galilee and proclaimed the gospel about the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The time is now! The kingdom of God is near! Repent, and keep believing the gospel!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew. They were throwing a net into the sea because they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Follow me, and I’ll make you fishers of people!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So immediately they left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on a little farther, he saw James, the son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat repairing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He immediately called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went to Capernaum. As soon as it was the Sabbaths, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were utterly amazed at his teaching, because he was teaching them like one with authority, and not like their scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of a sudden, there was a man in their synagogue who had an unclean spirit! He screamed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus rebuked him. “Be quiet,” he ordered, “and come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At this, the unclean spirit shook the man, cried out with a loud voice, and came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people were so stunned that they kept saying to each other, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He tells even the unclean spirits what to do, and they obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once his fame began to spread throughout the surrounding region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they left the synagogue, they went directly to the house of Simon and Andrew, along with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Simon’s mother-in-law was lying in bed, sick with a fever, so they promptly told Jesus about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up to her, took her by the hand, and helped her up. The fever left her, and she began serving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, after the sun had set, people started bringing to him everyone who was sick or possessed by demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, the whole city gathered at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases and drove out many demons. However, he wouldn’t allow the demons to speak because they knew who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, while it was still very dark, Jesus got up and went to a deserted place and prayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and his companions searched frantically for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they found him, they told him, “Everyone’s looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let’s go to the neighboring town,” he replied, “so I can preach there, too, because that’s why I came.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he went throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a leper came to Jesus and began pleading with him. He fell on his knees and told him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved with compassion, Jesus reached out his hand, touched him, and told him, “I do want to. Be made clean!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Instantly the leprosy left him, and he was clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sternly warned him and encouraged him to go at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the man, “Be sure that you don’t tell anyone. Instead, go and show yourself to the priest, and then offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded as proof to the authorities.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when the man left, he began to proclaim it freely. He spread the news so widely that Jesus could no longer enter a town openly, but had to stay out in deserted places. Still, people kept coming to him from everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Several days later, Jesus returned to Capernaum and it was reported that he was at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such a large crowd gathered that there wasn’t room for them, even in front of the door. Jesus was speaking his message to them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when some people came and brought him a paralyzed man being carried by four men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they couldn’t bring him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof over the place where he was. They dug through it and let down the mat on which the paralyzed man was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, he told the paralyzed man, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now some scribes were sitting there, arguing among themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this man talk this way? He is blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once, Jesus knew in his spirit what they were saying to themselves. “Why are you arguing about such things among yourselves?” he asked them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Which is easier: to say to the paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or ‘Get up, pick up your mat, and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins…” Then he told the paralyzed man,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I say to you, get up, pick up your mat, and go home!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
So the man got up, immediately picked up his mat, and went out in front of all of them.
As a result, all of the people were amazed and began to glorify God as they kept on saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out again beside the sea. The whole crowd kept coming to him, and he kept teaching them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was walking along, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax collector’s desk. Jesus told him, “Follow me!” So Levi got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Later, he was having dinner at Levi’s house. Many tax collectors and sinners were also eating with Jesus and his disciples, because there were many who were following him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the scribes and the Pharisees saw him eating with sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples, “Why does he eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that, he told them, “Healthy people don’t need a physician, but sick ones do. I did not come to call righteous people, but sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees would fast regularly. Some people came and asked Jesus, “Why do John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The wedding guests can’t fast while the groom is with them, can they? As long as they have the groom with them, they can’t fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the time will come when the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast on that day.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one patches an old garment with a piece of unshrunk cloth. If he does, the patch pulls away from it—the new from the old—and a worse tear is made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the wine will make the skins burst, and both the wine and the skins will be ruined. Instead, new wine is poured into fresh wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus happened to be going through the grain fields on a Sabbath. As they made their way, his disciples began picking the heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees asked him, “Look! Why are they doing what is not lawful on Sabbath days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: How was it that he went into the House of God during the lifetime of Abiathar the high priest and ate the Bread of the Presence, which was not lawful for anyone but the priests to eat, and gave some of it to his companions?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he told them, “The Sabbath was made for people, not people for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus went into the synagogue again, and a man with a paralyzed hand was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people watched Jesus closely to see whether he would heal him on the Sabbath, intending to accuse him of doing something wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the man with the paralyzed hand, “Come forward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “Is it lawful to do good or to do evil on Sabbath days, to save a life or to destroy it?” But they remained silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around at them in anger, deeply hurt because of their hard hearts. Then he told the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held it out, and his hand was restored to health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the Pharisees and Herodians went out and began to plot how to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea. A large crowd from Galilee, Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, Idumea, from across the Jordan, and from the region around Tyre and Sidon followed him. They came to him because they kept hearing about everything he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told his disciples to have a boat ready for him so that the crowd wouldn’t crush him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he had healed so many people that everyone who had diseases kept crowding up against him in order to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they would fall down in front of him and scream, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he sternly ordered them again and again not to tell people who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went up on a hillside and called to himself those whom he had decided on, and they approached him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed the Twelve, whom he called apostles, to accompany him, to be sent out to preach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have the authority to drive out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed the Twelve: Simon (whom he named Peter),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebedee’s sons James and his brother John (whom he named Boanerges, that is, Sons of Thunder),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddeus, Simon the Cananaean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went home. Such a large crowd gathered again that Jesus and his disciples couldn’t even eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his family heard about it, they went to restrain him, because they kept saying, “He’s out of his mind!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes who had come down from Jerusalem kept repeating, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “He drives out demons by the ruler of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus called them together and began to speak to them in parables. “How can Satan drive out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a household is divided against itself, that household won’t stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan rebels against himself and is divided, he cannot stand. Indeed, his end has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can go into a strong man’s house and carry off his possessions without first tying up the strong man. Then he can ransack his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, people will be forgiven their sins and whatever blasphemies they utter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit can never be forgiven, but is guilty of eternal sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: …because they had been saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his mother and his brothers arrived. Milling around outside, they sent for him, continuously summoning him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A crowd was sitting around him. They told him, “Look! Your mother and your brothers are outside asking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then looking at the people sitting around him, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does the will of God is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus began to teach again beside the sea. Such a large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it, while the entire crowd remained beside the sea on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began teaching them many things in parables. While he was teaching them he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! A farmer went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was sowing, some seeds fell along the path, and birds came and ate them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell on stony ground, where they didn’t have a lot of soil. They sprouted at once, because the soil wasn’t deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the sun came up, they were scorched. Since they didn’t have any roots, they dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell among thorn bushes, and the thorn bushes came up and choked them out, and they didn’t produce anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others fell on good soil and produced a crop. They grew up, increased in size, and produced 30, 60, or 100 times what was sown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He added, “Let the person who has ears to hear, listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was alone with the Twelve and those around him, they began to ask him about the parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “The secret about the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those on the outside, everything comes in parables
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that
‘they may see clearly but not perceive,
    and they may hear clearly but not understand,
        otherwise they might turn around and be forgiven.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “You don’t understand this parable, so how can you understand any of the parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmer sows the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people are like the seeds along the path, where the word is sown. When they hear it, Satan immediately comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others are like the seeds sown on the stony ground. When they hear the word, at once they joyfully accept it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but since they don’t have any roots, they last for only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes along because of the word, they immediately fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still others are like the seeds sown among the thorn bushes. These are the people who hear the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the worries of life, the deceitful pleasures of wealth, and the desires for other things come in and choke the word so that it can’t produce a crop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others are like the seeds sown on good soil. They hear the word, accept it, and produce crops—30, 60, or 100 times what was sown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “A lamp isn’t brought indoors to be put under a basket or under a bed, is it? It’s to be put on a lamp stand, isn’t it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing is hidden except for the purpose of having it revealed, and nothing is secret except for the purpose of having it come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him listen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on to say to them, “Pay attention to what you’re hearing! You will be evaluated by the same standard with which you do your evaluating, and still more will be given to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because whoever has something, will have more given to him. But whoever has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was also saying, “The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seeds on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sleeps and gets up night and day while the seeds sprout and grow, although he doesn’t know how
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ground produces grain by itself—first the stalk, then the head, then the full grain in the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the grain is ripe, he immediately starts cutting with his sickle because the harvest time has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was also saying, “How can we show what the kingdom of God is like, or what parable can we use to describe it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like a mustard seed planted in the ground. Although it’s the smallest of all the seeds on earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when it’s planted it comes up and becomes larger than all the garden plants. It grows such large branches that the birds in the sky can nest in its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many other parables like these, Jesus kept speaking his message to them according to their ability to understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not tell them anything without using a parable, though he explained everything to his disciples in private.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day, when evening had come, he told them, “Let’s cross to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they left the crowd and took him away in a boat without making any special preparations. Other boats were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A violent windstorm came up, and the waves began breaking into the boat, so that the boat was rapidly becoming swamped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus was in the back of the boat, asleep on a cushion. So they woke him up and asked him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we’re going to die?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he got up, rebuked the wind, and told the sea, “Calm down! Be still!” Then the wind stopped blowing, and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Why are you such cowards? Don’t you have any faith yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Overcome with fear, they kept saying to one another, “Who is this man? Even the wind and the sea obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They arrived at the other side of the sea in the territory of the Gerasenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Jesus stepped out of the boat, a man with an unclean spirit came out of the tombs and met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived among the tombs, and no one could restrain him any longer, not even with a chain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had often been restrained with shackles and chains, but had snapped the chains apart and broken the shackles in pieces. No one could tame him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kept screaming night and day among the tombs and on the mountainsides, and kept cutting himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and fell down in front of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: screaming in a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you in the name of God never to torment me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had been saying to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus asked him, “What’s your name?”
He told him, “My name is Legion, because there are many of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kept pleading with Jesus not to send them out of that region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large herd of pigs was grazing on a hillside nearby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons begged him, “Send us among the pigs, so that we can go into them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he let them do this. The unclean spirits came out of the man and went into the pigs, and the herd of about 2,000 rushed down a steep slope into the sea and drowned there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when those who had been taking care of the pigs ran away, they reported what had happened in the city and countryside. So the people went to see what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus and saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there dressed and in his right mind, they were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who had seen it told them what had happened to the demon-possessed man and the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they began to beg Jesus to leave their territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed kept begging him to let him go with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus wouldn’t let him. Instead, he told him, “Go home to your family, and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how merciful he has been to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man left and began proclaiming in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him. And everyone was utterly amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus again had crossed to the other side in a boat, a large crowd gathered around him by the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a synagogue leader named Jairus arrived. When he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and begged him urgently, saying, “My little daughter is dying. Come and lay your hands on her so that she may get well and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went with him. A huge crowd kept following him and jostling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a woman who had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although she had endured a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all of her money, she had not been helped at all, but rather grew worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since she had heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his robe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because she had been saying, “If I can just touch his robe, I will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her bleeding stopped at once, and she felt in her body that she was healed from her illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus became aware that power had gone out of him. So he turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “You see the crowd jostling you, and yet you ask, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept looking around to look at the woman who had done this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came forward fearfully, fell down trembling in front of him, and told him the whole truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace and be healed from your illness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, some people came from the synagogue leader’s home and said, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher anymore?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard what they said, he told the synagogue leader, “Stop being afraid! Just keep on believing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus allowed no one to go further with him except Peter, James, and John, the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw mass confusion. People were crying and sobbing loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered the house and asked them, “Why all this confusion and crying? The child isn’t dead. She’s sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed and laughed at him. But when he had driven all of them outside, he took the child’s father and mother, along with the men who were with him, and went into the room where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took her by the hand and told her, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Young lady, I tell you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young lady got up at once and started to walk. She was twelve years old. Instantly they were overcome with astonishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus strictly ordered them not to let anyone know about this. He also told them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left that place and went back to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were utterly amazed. “Where did this man get all these things?” they asked. “What is this wisdom that has been given to him? What great miracles are being done by his hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the builder, the son of Mary, and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas, and Simon, isn’t it? His sisters are here with us, aren’t they?” And they were offended by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had been telling them, “A prophet is without honor only in his hometown, among his relatives, and in his own home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He couldn’t perform a miracle there except to lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was amazed at their unbelief. Then he went around to the villages and continued teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the Twelve and began to send them out two by two, giving them authority over unclean spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He instructed them to take nothing along on the trip except a walking stick—no bread, no traveling bag, nothing in their moneybag.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They could wear sandals but not take along an extra shirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them repeatedly, “Whenever you go into a home, stay there until you leave that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any place will not welcome you and the people refuse to listen to you, when you leave, shake its dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went and preached that people should repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also kept driving out many demons and anointing with oil many who were sick, and healing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard about this, because Jesus’ name had become well-known. He was saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead! That’s why he is able to do these miracles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Others were saying, “He is Elijah.”
Still others were saying, “He is a prophet like one of the other prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod heard about it, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Herod himself had sent men who arrested John, bound him with chains, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, whom Herod had married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had been telling Herod, “It’s not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herodias bore a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she couldn’t do it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Herod was afraid of John. He knew that John was a righteous and holy man, and so he protected him. Whenever he listened to John, he did much of what he said. In fact, he liked listening to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An opportunity came during Herod’s birthday celebration, when he gave a banquet for his top officials, military officers, and the most important people of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his guests. So the king told the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I’ll give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He swore with an oath to her, “I’ll give you anything you ask for, up to half of my kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So she went out and asked her mother, “What should I ask for?”
Her mother replied, “The head of John the Baptist.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the girl hurried back to the king with her request, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king was deeply saddened, yet because of his oaths and his guests he was reluctant to refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So without delay the king sent a soldier and ordered him to bring John’s head. The soldier went and beheaded him in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought John’s head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s disciples heard about this, they came and carried off his body and laid it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles gathered around Jesus and told him everything they had done and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Come away to a deserted place all by yourselves and rest for a while,” because so many people were coming and going that they didn’t even have time to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went away in a boat to a deserted place by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when many people saw them leave and recognized them, they hurried on foot from all the towns and arrived ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he got out of the boat, he saw a large crowd. He had compassion for them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was quite late, his disciples came to him and said, “This is a deserted place, and it’s already late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send the crowds away so that they can go to the neighboring farms and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.”
They asked him, “Should we go and buy 200 denarii worth of bread and give it to them to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have? Go and see.”
They found out and told him, “Five loaves and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he ordered them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed them. Then he broke the loaves in pieces and kept giving them to his disciples to set before the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them ate and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples picked up twelve baskets full of leftover bread and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 5,000 men who had eaten the loaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus immediately had his disciples get into a boat and cross to Bethsaida ahead of him, while he sent the crowd away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying goodbye to them, he went up on a hillside to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, the boat was in the middle of the sea, while he was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw that his disciples were straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. Shortly before dawn he came to them, walking on the sea. He intended to go up right beside them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they saw him walking on the sea, they thought it was a ghost and began to scream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them saw him and were terrified. Immediately he told them, “Have courage! It’s me. Stop being afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he got into the boat with them, and the wind stopped blowing. The disciples were utterly astounded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they didn’t understand the significance of the loaves. Instead, their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they came ashore at Gennesaret and anchored the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they got out of the boat, the people recognized Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran all over the countryside and began carrying the sick on their mats to any place where they heard he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever he went, whether into villages, towns, or farms, people would place their sick in the marketplaces and beg him to let them touch even the tassel of his garment, and everyone who touched it was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They noticed that some of his disciples were eating with unclean hands, that is, without washing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Pharisees—and indeed all the Jewish people—don’t eat unless they wash their hands properly, following the tradition of their elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They don’t eat anything from the marketplace unless they dip it in water. They also observe many other traditions, such as the proper washing of washing cups, jars, brass pots, and dinner tables.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees and the scribes asked Jesus, “Why don’t your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders? Instead, they eat with unclean hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He told them, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites. As it is written,
‘These people honor me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their worship of me is worthless,
    because they teach human rules as doctrines.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You abandon the commandment of God and hold to human tradition.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “You have such a fine way of rejecting the commandment of God in order to keep your own tradition!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever curses his father or mother must certainly be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘If anyone tells his father or mother, “Whatever support you might have received from me is Corban,”’ (that is, an offering to God)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘you no longer let him do anything for his father or mother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are destroying the word of God through your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many other things like that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called to the crowd again and told them, “Listen to me, all of you, and understand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing that goes into a person from the outside can make him unclean. It’s what comes out of a person that makes a person unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had left the crowd and gone home, his disciples began asking him about the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Are you so ignorant? Don’t you know that nothing that goes into a person from the outside can make him unclean?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it doesn’t go into his heart but into his stomach, and then into the sewer, thereby expelling all foods.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he continued, “It’s what comes out of a person that makes a person unclean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it’s from within, from the human heart, that evil thoughts come, as well as sexual immorality, stealing, murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: adultery, greed, wickedness, cheating, shameless lust, envy, slander, arrogance, and foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these things come from inside and make a person unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left that place and went to the territory of Tyre and Sidon. He went into a house, not wanting anyone to know he was there. However, it couldn’t be kept a secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit immediately heard about him and came and fell down at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the woman happened to be a Greek, born in Phoenicia in Syria. She kept asking him to drive the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept telling her, “First let the children be filled. It is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the puppies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she answered him, “Yes, Lord. Yet even the puppies under the table eat some of the children’s crumbs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told her, “Because you have said this, go! The demon has left your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went home and found her child lying in bed, and the demon was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left the territory of Tyre and passed through Sidon towards the Sea of Galilee, in the territory of the Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people brought him a deaf man who also had a speech impediment. They begged him to lay his hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took him away from the crowd to be alone with him. Putting his fingers into the man’s ears, he touched the man’s tongue with saliva.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he looked up to heaven, sighed, and told him, “Ephphatha,” that is, “Be opened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man’s hearing and speech were restored at once, and he began to talk normally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus ordered the people not to tell anyone, but the more he kept ordering them, the more they kept spreading the news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amazed beyond measure, they kept on saying, “He does everything well! He even makes deaf people hear and mute people talk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, after a large crowd again had gathered together with nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples and told them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have compassion for the crowd, because they’ve already been with me for three days and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them away to their homes hungry, they’ll faint on the road. Some of them have come a long distance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples answered him, “Where could anyone get enough bread to feed these people out here in the wilderness?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?”
“Seven,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ordered the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the seven loaves and gave thanks. He broke them in pieces and kept giving them to his disciples to distribute. So they served them to the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also had a few small fish. He blessed them and said that the fish should also be distributed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people ate and were filled. Then the disciples picked up the leftover pieces—seven large baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about 4,000 men were there. Then he sent them on their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he got into a boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees arrived and began arguing with Jesus. They tested him by demanding from him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sighed deeply in his spirit and remarked, “Why do those living today demand a sign? I tell all of you with certainty, no sign will be given to this generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving them, he got into a boat again and crossed to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take any bread along, but they had one loaf with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had been warning them, “Watch out! Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were discussing with one another the fact that they didn’t have any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowing this, Jesus asked them, “Why are you discussing the fact that you don’t have any bread? Don’t you understand or perceive yet? Are your hearts hardened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you have eyes, but fail to see? Do you have ears, but fail to hear? Don’t you remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I broke the five loaves for the 5,000, how many baskets did you fill with leftover pieces?”
They told him, “Twelve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When I broke the seven loaves for the 4,000, how many large baskets did you fill with the leftover pieces?”
They told him, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “Don’t you understand yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they came to Bethsaida, some people brought a blind man to Jesus and begged him to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the village. He spit into his eyes, placed his hands on him, and asked him, “Do you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man looked up and said, “I see people, but they look like trees walking around.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus placed his hands on the man’s eyes again, and he saw clearly. His sight was restored, and he saw everything perfectly, even from a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent him home, saying, “Don’t go into the village or tell anyone in the village.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus and his disciples set out for the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he was asking his disciples, “Who do people say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “Some say John the Baptist, others Elijah, and still others one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he began to ask them, “But who do you say I am?”
Peter answered him, “You are the Messiah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sternly ordered them not to tell anyone about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to teach them that the Son of Man would have to suffer a great deal and be rejected by the elders, the high priests, and the scribes. Then he would be killed, but after three days he would rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was speaking about this matter quite openly.
Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But turning and looking at his disciples, Jesus rebuked Peter, saying, “Get behind me, Satan, because you’re not thinking God’s thoughts, but human thoughts!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called the crowd to himself along with his disciples and told them, “If anyone wants to follow me, he must deny himself, pick up his cross, and follow me continuously,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake and for the gospel will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What profit will a person have if he gains the whole world and forfeits his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, what can a person give in exchange for his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when he comes with the holy angels in his Father’s glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “I tell all of you with certainty, some people standing here will not experience death until they see the kingdom of God arrive with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John and led them up a high mountain to be alone with him. His appearance was changed in front of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his clothes became dazzling white, whiter than anyone on earth could bleach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah appeared to them, accompanied by Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter told Jesus, “Rabbi, it’s good that we’re here! Let’s set up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Peter didn’t know how to respond, because they were terrified.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a cloud appeared and overshadowed them. A voice came out of the cloud and said, “This is my Son, whom I love. Keep on listening to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, as they looked around, they saw no one with them but Jesus alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their way down the mountain, Jesus ordered them not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept the matter to themselves but argued about what “rising from the dead” meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Don’t the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Elijah is indeed coming first and will restore all things. Why, then, is it written that the Son of Man must suffer a great deal and be treated shamefully?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, yet people treated him just as they pleased, as it is written about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they approached the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and some scribes arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole crowd was very surprised to see Jesus and ran to welcome him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked the scribes, “What are you arguing about with them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man in the crowd answered him, “Teacher, I brought my son to you. He has a spirit that won’t let him talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever it brings on a seizure, it throws him to the ground. Then he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes stiff. So I asked your disciples to drive the spirit out, but they didn’t have the power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “You unbelieving generation! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought the boy to him. When the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into convulsions. He fell on the ground and kept rolling around and foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked his father, “How long has this been happening to him?” He said, “Since he was a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit has often thrown him into fire and into water to destroy him. But if you are able to do anything, have pity on us and help us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “‘If you are able?’ Everything is possible for the person who believes!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With tears flowing, the child’s father at once cried out, “I do believe! Help my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “You spirit that won’t let him talk or hear—I command you to come out of him and never enter him again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit screamed, shook the child violently, and came out. The boy was like a corpse, and many said that he was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took his hand and helped him up, and he stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came home, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we drive the spirit out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “This kind can come out only by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they left that place and passed through Galilee. Jesus didn’t want anyone to find out about it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was teaching his disciples, “The Son of Man will be betrayed into human hands. They will kill him, but after being dead for three days he will be raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t understand what this statement meant, and they were afraid to ask him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Capernaum. While Jesus was at home, he asked the disciples, “What were you arguing about on the road?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept silent, because they had argued on the road with one another about who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sat down, called the Twelve, and told them, “If anyone wants to be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a little child and had him stand among them. He took him in his arms and told them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever welcomes a child like this in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes not me but the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John told Jesus, “Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons in your name. We tried to stop him, because he wasn’t a follower like us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Don’t stop him, because no one who works a miracle in my name can slander me soon afterwards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink because you belong to the Messiah will never lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him if a large millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It’s better for you to enter life injured than to have two hands and go to hell, to the fire that cannot be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that place, worms never die, and the fire is never put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It’s better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that place, worms never die, and the fire is never put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out. It’s better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that place, worms never die, and the fire is never put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be salted with salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good. But if salt loses its taste, how can you restore its flavor? Keep on having salt among yourselves, and live in peace with one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left that place and went into the territory of Judea on the other side of the Jordan. Crowds gathered around him as usual, and he began to teach them again as was his custom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What did Moses command you?” he responded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses allowed a man to write a certificate of divorce and to divorce her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told them, “It was because of your hardness of heart that he wrote this command for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the beginning of creation, ‘God made them male and female.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why ‘a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two will become one flesh.’ So they’re no longer two, but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, what God has joined together, man must never separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Back in the house, the disciples asked him about this again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a woman divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people were bringing little children to Jesus to have him touch them. But the disciples rebuked those who brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw this, he became furious and told them, “Let the little children come to me, and stop keeping them away, because the kingdom of God belongs to people like these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, whoever doesn’t receive the kingdom of God as a little child will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after he had hugged the children, he tenderly blessed them as he laid his hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was setting out again, a man ran up to him, knelt down in front of him, and asked him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus asked him. “Nobody is good except for one—God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Never murder.’ ‘Never commit adultery.’ ‘Never steal.’ ‘Never give false testimony.’ ‘Never cheat.’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied to him, “Teacher, I have obeyed all of these since I was a young man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at him and loved him. Then he told him, “You’re missing one thing. Go and sell everything you own, give the money to the destitute, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come back and follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shocked at this statement, the man went away sad, because he had many possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus looked around and told his disciples, “How hard it will be for those who are wealthy to enter the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were startled by these words, but Jesus told them again, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in their wealth to get into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s easier for a camel to squeeze through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to get into the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were utterly amazed and asked one another, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them intently and said, “For humans it’s impossible, but not for God. All things are possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to say to him, “See, we have left everything and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I tell all of you with certainty, there is no one who has left his home, brothers, sisters, mother, father, children, or fields because of me and the gospel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive a hundred times as much here in this world—homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields, along with persecution—as well as eternal life in the age to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jesus and his disciples had been on the road going up to Jerusalem, with Jesus walking ahead of them. They were astonished, and the others who followed were afraid.
Once again, Jesus took the Twelve aside and began to tell them what was going to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pay attention! We’re going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the high priests and the scribes, and they’ll condemn him to death. Then they’ll hand him over to the unbelievers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they’ll make fun of him, spit on him, whip him, and kill him. But after three days he’ll be raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, went to Jesus and told him, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Let us sit in your glory, one on your right and one on your left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told them, “You don’t realize what you’re asking. Can you drink from the cup that I’m going to drink from or be baptized with the baptism with which I’m going to be baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They told him, “We can.”
Jesus told them, “You will drink from the cup that I’m going to drink and be baptized with the baptism with which I’m going to be baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it’s not up to me to grant you a seat at my right or my left. Those positions have already been prepared for others.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten other disciples heard this, they began to be furious with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called his disciples and told them, “You know that those who are recognized as rulers among the unbelievers lord it over them, and their superiors act like tyrants over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s not the way it should be among you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be first among you must be a slave to everyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Jericho. As Jesus, his disciples, and a large crowd were leaving Jericho, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus (that is, the son of Timaeus) was sitting by the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus of Nazareth was there, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people sternly told him to be quiet, but he started shouting even louder, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Jesus stopped and said, “Call him!”
So they called the blind man and told him, “Have courage! Get up. He’s calling you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He threw off his coat, jumped up, and went to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?”
The blind man told him, “Rabbouni, I want to see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Go. Your faith has made you well.” At once the man could see again, and he began to follow Jesus down the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near Jerusalem, at Bethphage and Bethany, near the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples on ahead
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told them, “Go into the village ahead of you. As soon as you go into it, you will find a colt tied up that no one has ever ridden. Untie it, and bring it along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?,’ say, ‘The Lord needs it,’ and he will send it back here at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went and found the colt outside in the street tied up next to a doorway. While they were untying it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: some men standing there asked them, “What are you doing untying that colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples told them what Jesus had said, and the men let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the colt to Jesus, threw their coats on it, and he sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people spread their coats on the road, while others spread leafy branches that they had cut in the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who went ahead and those who followed him were shouting,
“Hosanna!
How blessed is the one who comes
    in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the coming kingdom
    of our ancestor David!
Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went into Jerusalem and into the Temple and looked around at everything. Since it was already late, he went out with the Twelve to Bethany.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing in the distance a fig tree covered with leaves, he went to see if he could find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing except leaves because it wasn’t the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” Now his disciples were listening to this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jerusalem, he went into the Temple and began to throw out those who were selling and those who were buying in the Temple. He overturned the moneychangers’ tables and the chairs of those who sold doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wouldn’t even let anyone carry a vessel through the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to teach them: “It is written, is it not, ‘My house is to be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you’ve turned it into a hideout for bandits!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the high priests and elders heard this, they began to look for a way to kill him, because they were afraid of him, since the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples would leave the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were walking along early the next morning, they saw the fig tree dried up to its roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remembering what Jesus had said, Peter pointed out to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has dried up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told his disciples, “Have faith in God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ if he doesn’t doubt in his heart but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it and it will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever you stand up to pray, forgive whatever you have against anyone, so that your Father in heaven will forgive your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not forgive, your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went into Jerusalem again. While Jesus was walking in the Temple, the high priests, the scribes, and the elders came to him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked him, “By what authority are you doing these things, and who gave you this authority to do them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “I’ll ask you one question. Answer me, and then I’ll tell you by what authority I’m doing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was John’s authority to baptize from heaven or from humans? Answer me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began discussing this among themselves. “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he’ll say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From humans’…?” They were afraid of the crowd, because everyone really thought John was a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”
Then Jesus told them, “Then I won’t tell you by what authority I’m doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a pit for the wine press, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the right time, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect from them a share of the produce from the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the farmers grabbed the servant, beat him, and sent him back empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the man sent another servant to them. They beat the servant over the head and treated him shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man sent another, and that one they killed. So it was with many other servants. Some of these they beat, and others they killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He still had one more person to send, a son whom he loved. Finally, he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those farmers told one another, ‘This is the heir. Come on, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they grabbed him, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now what will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come, execute the farmers, and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haven’t you ever read this Scripture:
‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was the Lord’s doing,
    and it is amazing in our eyes’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were trying to arrest him but were afraid of the crowd. Realizing that he had spoken this parable against them, they left him alone and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sent some Pharisees and some Herodians to him, intending to trap him in what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came and told him, “Teacher, we know that you are sincere. You don’t favor any individual, because you pay no attention to external appearance. Instead, you teach the way of God truthfully. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not? Should we pay them or shouldn’t we?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing through their hypocrisy, Jesus replied to them, “Why are you testing me? Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they brought one. Then he asked them, “Whose face and name are on this?”
They told him, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told them, “Give back to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were utterly amazed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some Sadducees, who claim there is no resurrection, came to Jesus and asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no child, he should marry the widow and have children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first one married and died without having children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second married her and died without having children, and so did the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, whose wife will she be, since all seven had married her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Aren’t you mistaken because you don’t know the Scriptures or God’s power?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like the angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the dead being raised, haven’t you read in the book of Moses, in the story about the bush, how God said, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the scribes came near and heard the Sadducees arguing with one another. He saw how well Jesus answered them, so he asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of them all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “The most important is, ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you must love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is this: ‘You must love your neighbor as yourself.’ No other commandment is greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the scribe told him, “Well said, Teacher! You have told the truth that ‘God is one, and there is no other besides him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding, and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all the burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw how wisely the man answered, he told him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” After that, no one dared to ask him another question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was teaching in the Temple, he asked, “How can the scribes say that the Messiah is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself said by the Holy Spirit,
‘The Lord told my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
        until I put your enemies under your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David himself calls him ‘Lord,’ so how can he be his son?” And the large crowd kept listening to him with delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he taught, he said, “Beware of the scribes! They like to walk around in long robes, to be greeted in the marketplaces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devour widows’ houses and say long prayers to cover it up. They will receive greater condemnation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus sat facing the offering box, he watched how the crowd was dropping their money into it. Many rich people were dropping in large amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a destitute widow came and dropped in two small copper coins, worth about a cent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called his disciples and told them, “I tell all of you with certainty, this destitute widow has dropped in more than everyone who is contributing to the offering box,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because all of them contributed out of their surplus, but out of her poverty she has given everything she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was leaving the Temple, one of his disciples told him, “Look, Teacher! What stones! And what buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you see these large buildings?” Jesus responded. “Not even a single stone here will be left on top of another that won’t be demolished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives facing the Temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew were asking him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what is to be the sign when these things will be put into effect?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began by telling them, “See to it that no one deceives you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come in my name, proclaiming, ‘I AM,’ and they will deceive many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t panic. These things must take place, but the end won’t have come yet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. Furthermore, there will be earthquakes and famines in various places. These things are only a beginning of agonies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for yourselves, be on your guard! People will hand you over to local councils, and you will be beaten in their synagogues. You will stand before governors and kings in order to testify to them because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first, the gospel must be proclaimed to all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they take you away and hand you over for trial, don’t worry ahead of time about what you will say. Instead, say whatever is given to you at that time, because it won’t be you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated continuously by everyone on account of my name. But the person who endures to the end will be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So when you see the destructive desecration standing where it should not be (let the reader take note), then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who’s on his housetop must not come down and go into his house to take anything out of it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who’s in the field must not turn back to get his coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or who are nursing babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that it may not be in winter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because those days will be a time of suffering, a kind that has not happened from the beginning of creation—which God himself created—until now, and certainly will never happen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator
