verses.text: If the Lord had not shortened those days, no one would survive. But for the sake of the elect whom he has chosen, he has shortened those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time, if anyone says to you, ‘Look here! The Messiah!’, or, ‘Look there!’ don’t believe it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because false messiahs and false prophets will have arisen and will produce signs and omens intending to deceive, if possible, the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be on your guard! I’ve told you everything beforehand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But after the troubles of those days,
‘The sun will be darkened,
    the moon will not reflect its light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the stars will be falling out of the sky,
    and the powers that are in the heavens will be disrupted.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will see ‘the Son of Man coming in clouds’ with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He’ll send out the angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the most remote part of earth to the most remote part of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn a lesson from the fig tree. When its branches become tender and it produces leaves, you know that summer is approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see these things taking place, you will know that the Son of Man is near, right at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, this generation won’t disappear until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one knows when that day or hour will come—neither the angels in heaven nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful! Watch out! Because you don’t know when the time will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like a man who went on a trip. As he left home, he put his servants in charge, each with his own work, and he ordered the doorkeeper to be alert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So keep on watching, because you don’t know when the master of the house is coming—whether in the middle of the night, at the time the cock crows, or at daybreak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, he may come suddenly and find you asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m telling you what I’m telling everyone: Be alert!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was two days before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The high priests and the scribes were looking for a way to arrest Jesus secretly and to have him put to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they kept saying, “This must not happen during the festival. Otherwise, there’ll be a riot among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was in Bethany sitting at the table in the home of Simon the leper, a woman arrived with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume made from pure nard. She broke open the jar and poured the perfume on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Irritated, some who were there asked one another, “Why was the perfume wasted like this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This perfume could have been sold for more than 300 denarii and the money given to the destitute.” So they got extremely angry with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you’ll always have the destitute with you and can help them whenever you want, but you won’t always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has done what she could. She poured perfume on my body in preparation for my burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will also be told as a memorial to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the high priests to betray Jesus to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had listened to him, they were delighted and promised to give him money. So he began to look for a good opportunity to betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, Jesus’ disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover meal?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent two of his disciples, telling them, “Go into the city, and you will meet a man carrying a jug of water. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he goes into a house, say to its owner that the Teacher asks, ‘Where is my room where I can eat the Passover meal with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will show you a large upstairs room that is furnished and ready. Get everything ready for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples left and went into the city. They found everything just as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus arrived with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were at the table eating, Jesus said, “I tell all of you with certainty, one of you is going to betray me, one who is eating with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to be very sad and asked him, one after the other, “Surely I am not the one, am I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “It’s one of you Twelve, the one who is dipping his bread into the bowl with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is going away, just as it has been written about him, but how terrible it will be for that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for him if he had never been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, Jesus took a loaf of bread and blessed it. Then he broke it in pieces and handed it to them, saying, “Take some. This is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup, gave thanks, and gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “This is my blood of the covenant that is being poured out for many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, I’ll never again drink the product of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus told them, “All of you will turn against me, because it is written,
‘I will strike the shepherd,
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, after I’ve been raised, I’ll go to Galilee ahead of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter told him, “Even if everyone else turns against you, I certainly won’t.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “I tell you with certainty, today, this very night, before a rooster crows twice, you’ll deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter kept saying emphatically, “Even if I have to die with you, I’ll never deny you!” And all the others kept saying the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to a place called Gethsemane, and he told his disciples, “Sit down here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter, James, and John along with him, and he began to feel distressed and troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them, “I’m deeply grieved, even to the point of death. Wait here and stay awake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on a little farther, he fell to the ground and kept praying that if it were possible the hour might pass from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kept repeating, “Abba! Father! All things are possible for you. Take this cup away from me. Yet not what I want but what you want.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went back, he found his disciples asleep. “Simon, are you asleep?” he asked Peter. “You couldn’t stay awake for one hour, could you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of you must stay awake and pray that you won’t be tempted. The spirit is indeed willing, but the body is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away again and prayed the same prayer as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he came back and found them asleep, because they could not keep their eyes open. They didn’t even know what they should say to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came back a third time. “Are you still sleeping and resting?” he asked. “Enough of that! The time has come. Look! The Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up! Let’s go! See, the one who is betraying me is near!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, while Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. A crowd armed with swords and clubs was with him. They were from the high priests, the scribes, and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the betrayer personally had given them a signal, saying, “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him, and lead him safely away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas immediately went up to Jesus and said, “Rabbi,” and kissed him tenderly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men took hold of Jesus and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of those standing there drew his sword and struck the high priest’s servant, cutting off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me as if I were a bandit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day after day I was with you in the Temple teaching, yet you didn’t arrest me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the disciples deserted Jesus and ran away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain young man, who was wearing nothing but a linen sheet, was following Jesus. When the men grabbed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he left the linen sheet behind and ran away naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took Jesus to the high priest. All the high priests, elders, and scribes had gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed Jesus at a distance as far as the high priest’s courtyard. He was sitting with the servants and warming himself at the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the high priests and the whole Council were looking for some testimony against Jesus in order to have him put to death, but they couldn’t find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although many people gave false testimony against him, their testimony didn’t agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some men stood up and gave false testimony against him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We ourselves heard him say, ‘I will destroy this sanctuary made by human hands, and in three days I will build another one not made by human hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even on this point their testimony didn’t agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Don’t you have any answer to what these men are testifying against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept silent and didn’t answer at all. The high priest asked him again, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “I AM, and
‘you will see the Son of Man
    seated at the right hand of the Power’
        and ‘coming with the clouds of heaven.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his clothes. “Why do we still need witnesses?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have heard his blasphemy! What is your verdict?” All of them condemned him as deserving death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them began to spit on him. They blindfolded him and kept hitting him with their fists and telling him, “Prophesy!” Even the servants took him and slapped him around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was down in the courtyard, one of the high priest’s servant girls came by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw Peter warming himself, she glared at him and said, “You, too, were with Jesus from Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “I don’t know—or even understand—what you’re talking about!” Then he went out into the entryway. Just then a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant girl saw him and again told those who were standing around, “This man is one of them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again he denied it.
After a little while, the people who were standing there began to say to Peter again, “Obviously you’re one of them, because you are a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to invoke a divine curse and to swear with an oath, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just then a rooster crowed a second time.
Peter remembered that Jesus told him, “Before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” Then he broke down and cried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as it was morning, the high priests convened a meeting with the elders and scribes and the whole Council. They bound Jesus with chains, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
Jesus answered him, “You say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priests kept accusing him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked him again, “Don’t you have any answer? Look how many accusations they’re bringing against you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since Jesus no longer answered, Pilate was astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At every festival, Pilate would release any one prisoner whom the people requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man in prison named Barabbas. He had been with the insurgents who had committed murder during the rebellion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the crowd came and began to request that Pilate do for them what he always did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered them, “Do you want me to release the king of the Jews for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he knew that the high priests had handed him over due to jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the high priests stirred up the crowd to get him to release Barabbas for them instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked them again, “Then what should I do with the man you call ‘the King of the Jews’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Crucify him!” they shouted back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why?” Pilate asked them. “What has he done wrong?”
But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate, wanting to satisfy the crowd, released Barabbas for them, but he had Jesus whipped and handed over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led Jesus into the courtyard of the palace (that is, the governor’s headquarters) and called out the whole guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They dressed him in a purple robe, twisted some thorns into a victor’s crown, and placed it on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to greet him, “Long live the king of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept hitting him on the head with a stick, spitting on him, kneeling in front of him, and worshiping him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had finished making fun of him, they stripped him of the purple robe, put his own clothes back on him, and led him away to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They forced a certain passer-by named Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, who happened to be coming in from the country, to carry Jesus’ cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took Jesus to a place called Golgotha, which means Skull Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tried to give him wine mixed with myrrh, but he wouldn’t accept it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they crucified him. They divided his clothes among themselves by throwing dice to see what each one would get.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The written notice of the charge against him read, “The king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crucified two bandits with him, one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by kept insulting him, shaking their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who were going to destroy the sanctuary and rebuild it in three days—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save yourself and come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, the high priests, along with the scribes, were also making fun of him among themselves. They kept saying, “He saved others, but can’t save himself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Messiah, the king of Israel, come down from the cross now, since seeing is believing!” Even the men who were crucified with him kept insulting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At three o’clock, Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, eloi, lema sabachthani?” (which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When some of the people standing there heard this, they said, “Listen! He’s calling for Elijah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So someone ran and soaked a sponge in some sour wine. Then he put it on a stick and offered Jesus a drink, saying, “Wait! Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus gave a loud cry and breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtain in the sanctuary was torn in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion who stood facing Jesus saw how he had cried out and breathed his last, he said, “This man certainly was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were women watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of young James and Joseph, and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They used to accompany him and care for him while he was in Galilee. Many other women who had come up to Jerusalem with him were there, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the Day of Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath. Since it was already evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathea, a highly respected member of the Council, who was waiting for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate was amazed to hear that Jesus had already died, so he summoned the centurion to ask him if he was in fact dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned from the centurion that he was dead, he let Joseph have the corpse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph bought some linen cloth, took the body down, wrapped it in the cloth, laid it in a tomb that had been cut out of the rock, and rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph observed where the body had been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices to go and anoint Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early on the first day of the week, when the sun had just come up, they were going to the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they looked up and saw that the stone had been rolled away. (It was a very large stone.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went into the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were utterly astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “Stop being astonished! You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has been raised. He is not here. Look at the place where they laid him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go and tell his disciples—especially Peter—that Jesus is going ahead of you to Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they left the tomb and ran away, overwhelmed by shock and astonishment. They didn’t say a thing to anyone, because they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had risen early on the first day of that week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had driven out seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and told those who had been with Jesus and who now were grieving and crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard that he was alive and that he had been seen by her, they refused to believe Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus appeared in a different form to two disciples as they were walking into the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went back and told the others, who didn’t believe them, either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally he appeared to his eleven disciples while they were eating. He rebuked them for their unbelief and stubbornness, because they had not believed those who had seen him after he had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “As you go into the entire world, proclaim the gospel to everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever doesn’t believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the signs that will accompany those who believe: In my name they’ll drive out demons. they’ll speak in new languages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they’ll pick up snakes with their hands. Even if they drink any deadly poison, it won’t hurt them, and they’ll place their hands on the sick, and they’ll recover.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord Jesus, after talking with his disciples, was taken up to heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples went out and preached everywhere, while the Lord kept working with them and confirming the message by the signs that accompanied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
